Articles.Content: Each time I open ksp with my mods,the loading screen says that module manager applied the patches but No changes are made to the game

The ‘patches applied’ message really means there’s no errors in the patch as opposed to the patch has worked as intended.
 

So if you say misspell a filter term or use the wrong parameter etc it won’t work but won’t necessarily throw an error as it doesn’t know that “solarpnl3” is supposed to mean “solarpanel3”.

Which mods are you trying to install?
I tried to Install tweak scale but then I tried with Interstellar extended and it worked but there are empty places in my tech tree

1 hour ago, Quantum_intrication said:

I tried to Install tweak scale but then I tried with Interstellar extended and it worked but there are empty places in my tech t

Oof... probably get quicker help if you post on one of those mods' threads directly.
May also help to use CKAN to install, that will ensure that all dependencies are installed

7 hours ago, Quantum_intrication said:

I tried to Install tweak scale but then I tried with Interstellar extended and it worked but there are empty places in my tech tree

 

There’s been a couple of other recent threads about issues with tweakscale but I don’t think tweakscale touches the tech tree? Of course if you install just interstellar and not tweakscale and it works then you’ll know it’s something to do with tweakscale. But I’d follow @Stone Blue’s advice.

On 4/13/2021 at 4:44 PM, FruitGoose said:

There’s been a couple of other recent threads about issues with tweakscale but I don’t think tweakscale touches the tech tree? Of course if you install just interstellar and not tweakscale and it works then you’ll know it’s something to do with tweakscale. But I’d follow @Stone Blue’s advice.

No exactly, because interstellar has TweakScale embedded.

Unless you are not being able to scale things corretly, anything else is more likely to be a bad interaction with something else - or even bad patching.

And nothing, absolutely nothing on TweakScale can halt it from loading without MM complaining about a Reflection Error on it.

-- -- -- POST EDIT -- -- -- 

What leaded me to remember...

@Quantum_intrication, be sure to have installed 999_Scale_Redist.dll on the GameData folder (together Module Manager) and no on anywhere else. The absence of this file (or even moving it to the wrong place) may, indeed, trigger a Reflection exception that will be caught by MM, that will halt the loading.

Edited April 15, 2021 by Lisias
Post edit
